instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.ADAPTOR_EN: What is ADAPTOR_EN? This is a typo of SMC_ADAPTER_EN When you see ADAPTOR_EN, assume they meant to type SMC_ADAPTER_EN.
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: MacBook Air 11” 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green
threads.message:
Hi.
I have a MacBook Air 11” that has no power there is no green.
No liquid damaged.


now state.

J7000 MLB to LIO Power Cable Connector
Pin1(<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>) = 14.48v
Pin2(<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>) = 14.48v
Pin3(<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>) = 0v


"G3Hot" (Always-Present) Rails
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 7.9V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> = 14.48V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> = 14.48V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3V


5V Rails
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 7.98V
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 7.98V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> = 0


smc data lines
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V(<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> Pin7)
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> 3.3V(<RESISTOR>R5187</RESISTOR> Pin1)
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 0V(<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> Pin5)
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 0.11V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> 0V(<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> Pin12)


<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> is bad?
Do you have any idea on what is causing this?


thanks.

threads.title: MacBook Air 11” 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green
threads.message:
I noticed you listed voltages for S0 rails... but.....

No <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = no <SIGNAL>ADAPTOR_EN</SIGNAL> = no <SIGNAL>SLP_S5</SIGNAL>
There is no point looking at anything (power state wise) above 3.42V - 8.6V and S5 rails

threads.title: MacBook Air 11” 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green
threads.message: You have a smc reset issue, ppbus should be at last 8.5v. Smc shouldnt fail unless liquid got in. <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> is the ideal suspect.

threads.title: MacBook Air 11” 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green
threads.message: SMC can and does fail without liquid.... I am not saying that is the problem, just that they DO fail.

threads.title: MacBook Air 11” 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> should be 3.42v. 0.5v means shorted SMC, 0v means bad <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> usually. 

1) What does <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> measure? This resistor pulls up <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> to 3.42v. 
2) What voltage do you get for <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> when you remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>?

If you remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> is good, and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is still low - the SMC is pulling it down.
If you remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes up to 3.42v, then <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> was bad.

threads.title: MacBook Air 11” 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green
threads.message:
Thank you all .

>> 1) What does <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> measure? This resistor pulls up <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> to 3.42v.

<RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR>
Pin1 = 3.3v
Pin2 = 0v
Resistance value = 100k ohm

>>2) What voltage do you get for <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> when you remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>?

I will try to check up on that.

thanks

threads.title: MacBook Air 11” 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green
threads.message:
Hi.

I removed <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.

<RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR>
Pin1 = 3.3v
Pin2 = 3.0v(<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>)

<RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR>
Pin1 = 3.0v
Pin2 = 3.0v3.0v(<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>)

and charger light is green on.

I think <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> is bad.


I ordered donor-board and tools. 

AmScope SE400-Z Professional Binocular Stereo Microscope
Solder Paste XG-50 
smc Stencil 

I ordered by ebay and aliexpress
I think it will take time to deliver, because i live japan.


thanks

threads.title: MacBook Air 11” 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green
threads.message: Good chance <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> is bad. However, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> should be 3.3v at least, not 3.0v. That is worrisome.

threads.title: MacBook Air 11” 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green
threads.message:
I feel the same way.
I’ll give it a try.

thanks

threads.title: MacBook Air 11” 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no green
threads.message: The board can work without <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>. Apply power and after that manually short <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> to GND for a fraction to give the SMC a "clean" start. That is basically what <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> does only within a few milli seconds. PPBUS should now come up at 8.6ish Volts.
